before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fgge0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ivqb","text":"Sampling and storage for nuclear isolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1autf","text":"Animals must be appropriately euthanized and immediately processed. Approximately ~  of  tissue is placed in one clearly labelled cryotube and immediately flash frozen in liquid nitrogen. This step is critical. The tissue must be preserved as fast as possible for optimal results. In the absence of liquid nitrogen, samples can be frozen in dry ice. Samples can be stored at   for up to a year prior to use. Older samples might still yield viable nuclei but this would need to be tested.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":188,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":375,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ke8s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ngv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87koj","text":"All reagents should be chilled on ice prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gdvg","text":"Samples should be kept frozen on dry ice until immediately before nuclei isolation, and all sample-handling steps should be performed on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej6g","text":"The centrifuge should be pre chilled at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"avld3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mluv","text":"All reagents are given for 2 nuclear isolations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54ji8","text":"Amounts of buffer especially those that contain RNase should be adjusted appropriately for each experiment prepared prior and RNase added immediately before use.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acp8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"entrf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q25b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"guid":"1E192CF1C72311ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1E192DC8C72311ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4770F290C72311ECBCA9CD795F7B3B82","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4eh4v","text":"Here we present a modified version of : dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.261genwm7g47/v2 that was used to successfully extract nuclei from an array of different tissue types for single cell sequencing and modify it with the purpose of extracting nuclei for single cell multiome ATAC and gene expression on the 10x chromium. The modifications for this protocol include: different concentration of RNase inhibitors, different quantities for nuclear isolation buffer, removal of unnecessary steps as well as QC specific for multiome analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"bddpp","text":"If you are looking to use this protocol for bulk ATAC-seq use of protease inhibitor cocktail PIC is recommended instead of RNase inhibitor on the snRNA-seq version of this protocol (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.261genwm7g47/v2) please get in touch with the authors if you are unsure on how to do this.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7D84FCADBC1E11EDA55C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.261genwm7g47/v2"}}}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"eakuj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5utqo","text":"Before using this prep for library preparation do a trial run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4qrp","text":"It is recommended to conduct a trial, especially on a new tissue type, to adjust various parameters without introducing RNase. This allows for the adjustment of parameters such as mincing times, filter size, and dilution into the final buffer, which ultimately leads to the production of good quality nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eubuk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehoh4","text":"For multiome snRNA-seq and single cell ATAC-seq, it is advisable to perform a trial run where the quality of the nuclei is assessed by examining their integrity and the quality of their nuclear membrane (as shown in the picture in step 2.1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hbbu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v4ft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sh8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3936f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i2b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40dcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kfbu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqgsl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j22i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16s7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f64o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

must be appropriately euthanized and immediately processed. Approximately ~  of salmonid tissue is placed in one clearly labelled cryotube and immediately flash frozen in liquid nitrogen. This step is critical. The tissue must be preserved as fast as possible for optimal results. In the absence of liquid nitrogen, samples can be frozen in dry ice. Samples can be stored at   for up to a year prior to use. Older samples might still yield viable nuclei but this would need to be related_materials.name: Bovine Serum Albumin (20 mg/mL) Molecular Biology Grade
Calcium chloride 1 M in aqueous solution
Tungsten Carbide Straight 11.5 cm Fine Scissors
Corning™ Falcon™ Test Tube with 35µm Cell Strainer Snap Cap
Magnesium chloride solution for molecular biology (1.00 M)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4oh2b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8td7m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"rf07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":134},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":177}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e7b6v","text":"Samples should be kept frozen on dry ice until immediately before nuclei isolation, and all sample-handling steps should be performed  . The centrifuge should be pre-chilled at  .","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"efob7","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"08254580CB0811EC8C6DB59C33891251","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"1":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FE329460CB0711EC8C6DB59C33891251","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"895437D0CAFC11EC8C6DB59C33891251","id":"51554","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"0B44D360C68611ECB0FA617616DB1AAA","id":"93341","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8h1go","text":"If the sample is stuck to the cryotube, remove using tweezers, preferably while still in dry ice, and place immediately into the culture plate with TST. If the sample needs processing for examples cutting this is best done on dry ice. This is avoided by processing the sample prior to flash freezing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42ta9","text":" , mince tissue initially using Tungsten Carbide scissors for   and then with Noyes Spring Scissors   for a total of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":100,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5lukd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7pg20","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2mojl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8D8892B0CAFC11EC8C6DB59C33891251","id":"51555","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"376C1B50C72211ECB0FA617616DB1AAA","id":"82740","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":204952,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Noyes Spring Scissors - ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":600,"guid":"3335F14DC71C11ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28ops","text":"  into the mincing gently pipette up and down with a p1000 pipette using a low retention filtered tip. The time in the dissociation buffer is critical. See image for how to assess the timing is correct by looking at your nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"220rn","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9ehl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"58444830C68611ECB0FA617616DB1AAA","id":"82742","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DDC500D0C71C11EC96AADDF77860D146","height":139,"id":354819,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":112,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":213,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":290,"style":"bold"}],"key":"32tkf","text":"Image from different dissociation trials in Atlantic salmon tissues x40 magnification stained with trypan blue. A. Head kidney nuclei not had sufficient time in dissociation buffer, will clog microfluidic device. B. Blood nuclei perfectly dissociated minimal clumping ideal for sequencing. C. Liver nuclei to long in dissociation buffer, nuclear membrane started to degrade. Can still be sequenced but not ideal. Note when staining nuclei with trypan blue asses nuclear quality as soon as possible as the nuclei will quickly degrade when not on ice.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8lfuo","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k4sfbrt4x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k4sdbrt4x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k4sebrt4x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k4scbrt4x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4g1d0","text":"Add a further   of TST to the cell strainer immediately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"ABED83D8C68611EC9FE10A58A9FEAC02","id":"93342","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7no5","text":"Add   of freshly prepared ST buffer to the lysate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cd58i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"C92B05C0C68611ECB0FA617616DB1AAA","id":"93343","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"384d1","text":"Add the   of lysate to a marked 15 ml falcon tube (Corning) on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1s988","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"E53B0350C68611ECB0FA617616DB1AAA","id":"93344","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evffb","text":"Discard liquid, carefully remove excess liquid with a p200 pipette, careful to not disturve the pellet. Resuspend the pellet gently using a p1000 pipette in diluted nuclei buffer in aiming for target recover of 6.000 nuclei. The concentration of RNAse inhibitor should be 1U/ul.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":275,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"abcnp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"emhc","text":"7/v2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"brrc2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6F300C65BC2011EDA55C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.261genwm7g47/v2"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":83},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":87},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":90},{"key":3,"length":1,"offset":137}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gltq","text":"Resuspension volume depends on the size of the pellet, usually within the range of   -   (  if there are many nuclei). For skin and fin,   is recommended.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"3D30C811C71D11ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"3D30C89CC71D11ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"2":{"data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"3D30C91FC71D11ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"3":{"data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"37C7DC3BC71D11ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm7hk","text":"Count the nuclei using a C-chip disposable haemocytometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"891hp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6133e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d3ai0","text":"In this step, it is also possible to visualise the nuclei and ascertain the level of debris present as well as the integrity of the nuclear membrane. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4judf","text":"Alternativly a non-disposable haemocytometer can be used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a53os","text":"The nuclei are also counted using a Bio-Rad TC20 to confirm results from the disposable haemocytometer and to count the proportion of viable cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6bm0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dicr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"46acn","text":"Nuclei are identified as “dead”, therefore a good nuclei isolation will have a small percentage of live cells. 1-4% of live cells is ideal. High proportions of live cells indicates incomplete nuclear isolation and could be an indication of high amounts of debris or insufficient lysis time.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
